intro: Heliocarpus chontalensis, commonly known as Chontal hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces woody, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Heliocarpus chontalensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
